content.description: Pull through the small overhang then follow the relatively clean, straight 1-3" crack system.  This is a great moderate lead. Consistent climbing with plenty of pro opportunities
content.protection: Standard rack.  Takes lots of gear (nuts, cams to 3" etc.).
content.location: In the middle of the south-facing wall that is opposite the Rite of Spring Wall.  Starts in a small cave-like opening.

content.description: Nice climb with good gear the whole way up. One section is somewhat strenuous and may be difficult for a beginning leader (given that it is rated 5.4).

A beautiful, overhanging crack line, that has a cave like start.  The first 25ft, consists of the powerful crux with awkward jams and technical moves. Fun climbing on the warmest winter section of walls in CT.
content.protection: Good gear, standard modern rack, selection of stoppers and cams to 2".
content.location: To the left of the Amphitheater proper. Between Castle Crag and the Amphitheater. Look for the obvious hard looking, overhanging crack line. To get down, walk around the block it's left side back to the start of the route.

content.description: The face climb to the right of Right of Spring.Work up to the overlap, then go straight up the face to the top.
The arête on the south-facing wall opposite the Rite of Spring Wall.
content.protection: Not a lot of pro.  Standard rack (small pieces).  Trees at top for top-roping.

content.description: Follow obvious vertical crack system in the center of the wall.
content.protection: Standard rack with small cams.  Suitable trees at top for TR.
content.location: From the Rite of Spring Wall, traverse right (about 40 feet) around the arête of the opposing, south-facing wall and half-way up a steep goat trail on the other side. The crack is a little hard to see until you clamber up.

content.description: A very pleasant easy route.  Ideal for new trad leaders.  Follow the obvious crack system up the center of the wall.
content.protection: Standard rack.  This route eats pro.  Suitable trees for top-roping.
content.location: On the low-angle, south-facing wall that is across from the Rite of Spring Wall.

content.description: This area contains three walls.  Left to right, the first is Rite of Spring Wall with 90 foot climbs in the 5.9-5.11 range.  Opposite is a low-angle, south-facing wall with easier routes (5.3-5.7).  Around the arête of this wall is another more vertical wall with Modern Eyes (5.9).
